alert.note: Alert for Rensselaer; Saratoga; Schenectady (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 3:09PM EDT until July 29 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central New York, including the following counties, Albany, Rensselaer, Saratoga and Schenectady. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 307 PM EDT, public and trained spotters reported heavy rain and water over roads in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Schenectady, Troy, Clifton Park, Rotterdam, Cohoes, Scotia, Mechanicville, Latham, Niskayuna, Green Island, Waterford, Round Lake, Country Knolls, Alplaus, Burnt Hills, East Glenville, Halfmoon, Malta, Charlton and Stillwater. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report flooding to the National Weather Service by email at ALB.stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany.
